items.title: Echo Station Overview
items.summary: **Summary** Echo Station is a human-in-the-loop, symbol-driven encyclopedia and codex. It ships as a static site with dark, no-flash rendering and URL-driven search. Entries are organized with *clusters* (e.g., `glome-s3`, `tesseract`, `spiral-engine`) and short *tags*.

items.title: Glome Basics (S³)
items.summary: **Summary** We treat S³ as the *navigational* substrate for glyph lattices. We rely on stereographic projection for visualization and Hopf fibrations for fiber-wise traversal.

items.title: Tesseract → Glome (Migration Notes)
items.summary: - Preserve edge-adjacency semantics via Hopf fiber neighborhoods.
